oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copper deficiency in ruminants: recent developments
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Suttle, N. F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The aetiology of copper deficiency in grazing ruminants has been clarified by a number of recent discoveries: the low availability of copper in lush grazed pasture compared with conserved forage; the inhibitory effects on absorption of small increases in herbage molybdenum and sulphur and the antagonism from iron ingested in soil; and the wide genetic variation in copper absorption between different breeds of sheep. Full article published in Veterinary Record (1986) 119, 519-522
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1986; 75
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright (c) 1986 American Association of Bovine Practitioners
